Name: Aceh
Description: A province on the northern tip of Sumatra, known for its rich history, culture, and natural beauty.

Name: Bali
Description: A world-renowned tourist destination known for its beaches, temples, and vibrant culture.

Name: Bangka Belitung Islands
Description: A province known for its tin production, beautiful beaches, and small islands.

Name: Banten
Description: A province on the westernmost part of Java, known for its modernity and historical sites.

Name: Bengkulu
Description: A province located on the southwestern coast of Sumatra, known for its natural beauty and rich history.

Name: Gorontalo
Description: A province on the island of Sulawesi, known for its marine biodiversity and tranquil atmosphere.

Name: Jakarta
Description: The capital and largest city of Indonesia, known for its economic significance and vibrant urban culture.

Name: Jambi
Description: A province on Sumatra, known for its agricultural products and ancient temples.

Name: Java
Description: The most populous island in Indonesia, home to the capital city, Jakarta, and known for its cultural, historical, and economic significance.

Name: Kalimantan
Description: The Indonesian part of Borneo, known for its rainforests, wildlife, and rich natural resources.

Name: Lampung
Description: A province on the southern tip of Sumatra, known for its agricultural production and scenic landscapes.

Name: Maluku
Description: A province made up of numerous islands, known for its history as the Spice Islands and its natural beauty.

Name: North Maluku
Description: A province in eastern Indonesia, known for its islands, natural resources, and maritime history.

Name: North Sulawesi
Description: A province in northern Sulawesi, known for its natural beauty, marine biodiversity, and rich culture.

Name: North Sumatra
Description: A province in western Sumatra, known for its ethnic diversity, lakes, and agriculture.

Name: Papua
Description: A province in the western part of New Guinea, known for its indigenous cultures, rainforests, and biodiversity.

Name: West Papua
Description: A province located in the western part of New Guinea, known for its indigenous communities and rugged landscapes.

Name: Riau
Description: A province on the eastern coast of Sumatra, known for its palm oil industry and natural resources.

Name: South Kalimantan
Description: A province in Indonesian Borneo, known for its coal mining industry and rich cultural heritage.

Name: South Sulawesi
Description: A province in southern Sulawesi, known for its vibrant culture, economic growth, and agricultural products.

Name: South Sumatra
Description: A province in Sumatra, known for its natural resources, particularly coal, and its vibrant culture.

Name: Southeast Sulawesi
Description: A province in southeastern Sulawesi, known for its mining industry, biodiversity, and beautiful landscapes.

Name: West Java
Description: A province in western Java, known for its dense population, economic development, and proximity to Jakarta.

Name: West Kalimantan
Description: A province on the Indonesian part of Borneo, known for its rainforests, rivers, and diverse ethnic groups.

Name: West Nusa Tenggara
Description: A province in the eastern part of Indonesia, known for its tourism, beaches, and rich culture.

Name: West Papua
Description: A province in the western part of New Guinea, known for its indigenous cultures, rugged landscapes, and rich biodiversity.
